newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada dollar ends weaker on technical correction.
newsitem.headline: Canada dollar ends weaker on technical correction.

text.p: * The Canadian dollar ended weaker at C$1.3387 (US$0.7478)
from this morning's open of C$1.3384 (US$0.7471), renewing its
trek towards a technical support level of C$1.3405
* They said the currency is expected to continue weakening as
a result of pressure from Canada's low interest rates.
Canada's dollar ended weaker at C$1.3387 (US$0.7478) from this morning's open of C$1.3384 (US$0.7471), renewing its trek towards a technical support level of C$1.3405 (US$0.7459), dealers said.

They said international investors drove the unit weaker in reaction to suggestions the Bank of Canada could continue cutting short-term interest rates if the central bank believed Canadian inflation might fall below one percent.
"We saw everybody today," one dealer said. "International funds, speculators, corporates all reacting to the possibility of lower interest rates."
Bank of Canada Governor Gordon Thiessen said earlier this week that the Bank of Canada saw a pickup in Canada's economy.

But he was concerned that it might not be enough to keep inflation from slipping below the bank's one to three percent target. "The economy shows signs of picking up, but the momentum in the economy is not sufficiently well established to say that a drop in inflation below 1.0 percent would be temporary," Thiessen said on Thursday.
On the crosses, the Canadian dollar fell to 1.1267 marks from Thursday's close of 1.1297 marks and slid to 82.93 yen from 83.42 yen.
